namespace.description: Forces a specific namespace for connectors that perform namespace auto-detection (Advanced).

collectPeriod.description: Sets the collect period that Hardware Sentry uses to collects metrics from the monitored hosts (Default: 2m).

disableAlerts.description: Disables Hardware Sentry's alerts for all the monitored hosts (Default: false).

discoveryCycle.description: Sets the cycle that Hardware Sentry uses to perform discoveries and detect new components in your monitored environment. By default, Hardware Sentry runs a discovery after 30 collects.

exporter.description: Sets Hardware Sentry's internal Exporter configuration.

otlp.description: Overrides Hardware Sentry's internal OTLP Exporter configuration.

headers.description: Sets Hardware Sentry's OTLP Exporter headers, such as the `Authorization` header used to authenticate the Exporter with the OTLP gRPC Receiver.

trustedCertificatesFile.description: Sets Hardware Sentry's OTLP Exporter trusted certificates file (Default: security/otel.crt).

extraLabels.description: Adds or overrides the attributes for all the monitored hosts. It is recommended to specify a different `site` label value for each OpenTelemetry Collector running the Hardware Sentry Agent.

extraMetrics.description: Adds additional static metrics to be exposed by Hardware Sentry.

hardwareProblemTemplate.description: Overrides the default hardware problem template used to build the alert body for all the monitored hosts.

collectPeriod.description: Sets the default collect period that Hardware Sentry uses to collects metrics from the monitored host (Default: 2m).

disableAlerts.description: Disables Hardware Sentry's alerts for the monitored host (Default: false).

discoveryCycle.description: Sets the cycle that Hardware Sentry uses to perform discoveries and detect new components for the specific host. By default, Hardware Sentry runs a discovery after 30 collects.

excludedConnectors.description: Sets the Connector(s) that must be excluded from the automatic detection.

extraLabels.description: Adds or overrides the attributes of the monitored host.

hardwareProblemTemplate.description: Overrides the default hardware problem template used to build the alert body for the monitored host.

host.description: Configures a new host to be monitored.

hostname.description: Configures the hostname of the host to be monitored.

id.description: Configures the identifier of the host to be monitored (Optional). By default, the host identifier is the hostname property value.

type.description: Configures the type of the host to be monitored.

http.description: Configures the HTTP protocol to access the host.

https.description: Enables HTTPS to access the host (Default: true).

password.description: Sets the password used to establish the connection with the host through the HTTP protocol.

port.description: Sets the HTTPS port number used to perform HTTP requests (Default: 443).

timeout.description: Sets how long until the HTTP request times out (Default: 120s).

username.description: Sets the username used to establish the connection with the host through the HTTP protocol.

ipmi.description: Configures the IPMI protocol to access the host.

password.description: Sets the password used to establish the connection with the host through the IPMI protocol.

timeout.description: Sets how long until the IPMI request times out (Default: 120s).

username.description: Sets the username used to establish the connection with the host through the IPMI protocol.

loggerLevel.description: Enables the debug mode of the core engine on the specific host (Default: off).

operationTimeout.description: Sets how long until the engine's discovery and collect operations time out.

osCommand.description: Configures the OS Command protocol to access the host.

sudoCommand.description: Sets the sudo command to be used for the host to be monitored (Default: sudo).

timeout.description: Sets how long until the local OS Command times out (Default: 120s).

useSudo.description: Sets if sudo needs to be used for the local OS Command (Default: false).

useSudoCommands.description: Sets the list of commands for which sudo is required.

outputDirectory.description: Sets the debug output directory for the monitored host. By default, the debug output file is saved in the `logs` directory under the Hardware Sentry's home directory.

selectedConnectors.description: Sets the Connector(s) to use to monitor the host. No automatic detection will be performed.

sequential.description: Forces all the network calls to be executed in sequential order for the monitored host - NOT RECOMMENDED (Default: false).

snmp.description: Configures the SNMP protocol to access the host.

community.description: Sets the SNMP Community string to use to perform SNMP v1 queries (Default: public).

password.description: SNMP v3 only - Sets the password to use for performing the SNMP query.

port.description: Sets the SNMP port number used to perform SNMP queries (Default: 161).

privacy.description: SNMP v3 only - Sets the type of encryption protocol.

privacyPassword.description: SNMP v3 only - Sets the password associated to the privacy protocol.

timeout.description: Sets how long until the SNMP request times out (Default: 120s).

username.description: SNMP v3 only - Sets the username to use for performing the SNMP query.

version.description: Sets the version of the SNMP protocol (Default: v1).

ssh.description: Configures the SSH protocol to access the host.

password.description: Sets the password to use for performing the SSH query.

privateKey.description: Sets the private Key File to use to establish the connection to the host through the SSH protocol.

sudoCommand.description: Sets the sudo command to be used.

timeout.description: Sets how long until the command times out (Default: 120s).

useSudo.description: Sets if sudo needs to be used for the SSH Command (Default: false).

useSudoCommands.description: Sets the list of commands for which sudo is required.

username.description: Sets the username to use for performing the SSH query.

wbem.description: Configures the WBEM protocol to access the host.

password.description: Sets the password used to establish the connection with the host through the WBEM protocol.

port.description: Sets the HTTPS port number used to perform WBEM queries (Default: 5989 for HTTPS or 5988 for HTTP).

protocol.description: Sets the protocol used to access the host (Default: https).

timeout.description: Sets how long until the WBEM request times out (Default: 120s).

username.description: Sets the username used to establish the connection with the host through the WBEM protocol.

winrm.description: Configures the WinRM protocol to access the host.

authentications.description: Sets an ordered list of authentication schemes (Default: ["ntlm"]).

password.description: Sets the password used to establish the connection with the host through the WinRM protocol.

port.description: Sets the port number used to perform WQL queries and commands (Default: 5985 for HTTP or 5986 for HTTPS).

protocol.description: Sets the protocol used to access the host (Default: http).

timeout.description: Sets how long until the WinRM request times out (Default: 120s).

username.description: Sets the username used to establish the connection with the host through the WinRM protocol.

wmi.description: Configures the WMI protocol to access the host.

password.description: Sets the password used to establish the connection with the host through the WMI protocol.

timeout.description: Sets how long until the WMI request times out (Default: 120s).

username.description: Sets the username used to establish the connection with the host through the WMI protocol.

jobPoolSize.description: Sets the number of jobs that Hardware Sentry can run simultaneously (Default: 20).

loggerLevel.description: Enables the debug mode of the core engine (Default: off).

outputDirectory.description: Sets the debug output directory for all the monitored hosts. By default, the debug output files are saved in the `logs` directory under the Hardware Sentry's home directory.

resolveHostnameToFqdn.description: Displays the configured hostname in the Host Resource `host.name` attribute instead of the resolved FQDN (Default: false).

sequential.description: Forces all the network calls to be executed in sequential order for all the monitored hosts - NOT RECOMMENDED (Default: false).
